item.title: The US will buy 2 million doses of an HIV prevention drug for low-income countries
item.description: The U.S. is purchasing enough doses of a new twice-a-year HIV prevention shot to share with up to 2 million people in poor countries by 2028

item.title: Average rate on a 30-year mortgage drops to 6.5%, lowest level since last October
item.description: The average rate on a 30-year U.S. mortgage fell again this week, extending a recent trend that should give prospective homebuyers more purchasing pow...

item.title: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un meets with Chinese leader Xi Jinping
item.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un met with Chinese leader Xi Jinping on the sidelines of festivities commemorating the end of World War II, state media ...

item.title: LSD shows promise for reducing anxiety in drugmaker's midstage study
item.description: A midstage study of the psychedelic drug LSD showed positive results for easing symptoms in people with generalized anxiety disorder

item.title: Applications for US jobless benefits rise but remain in healthy range
item.description: The number of Americans seeking jobless benefits rose modestly last week, a sign that employers are still retaining workers even as the economy has sh...
